folder.title: CHIRPS
folder.description: Climate Hazard group InfraRed Precipitation with Stations (CHIRPS) is a global (50%B0 S-50%B0 N, 180%B0 E-180%B0 W), 0.05%B0 resolution, 1981 to near-present gridded precipitation time series. CHIRPS data are produced by scientists at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB) Climate Hazard Group (CHG) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center. Data are provided as pentadal (5-day) composites. See readme for CHIRPS data.

folder.name: fewschirps:fewschirps_fewscamcar_1-pentad-{{period}}-{{year}}_mm_data
folder.title: Pentadal
folder.description:
Climate Hazard group InfraRed Precipitation with Stations (CHIRPS) is a global (50%B0 S-50%B0 N, 180%B0 E-180%B0 W), 0.05%B0 resolution, 1981 to near-present gridded precipitation time series. CHIRPS data are produced by scientists at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB) Climate Hazard Group (CHG) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center. Data are provided as pentadal (5-day) composites. See readme for CHIRPS data.

Using IDL these data are accumulated to create monthly, 2-monthly and 3-monthly rainfall data. Individual observations are subtracted from the time series mean (2000-present) to produce anomaly data. Standard Precipitation Index maps (zscores) are made by applying a gamma function routine developed by Greg Husak, precip_2_spi_gh.pro

All three products, data, anomaly and zscores are converted to GeoTiffs to be ingested into EWX.

Questions?

About the Data: email Pete Peterson
About EWX: email Michael Budde

folder.name: fewslstc6:fewslstc6_fewsglobal_1-dekad-{{period}}-{{year}}_mm_data
folder.title: Dekadal
folder.description:
MODIS LST is the Land Surface Temperature measured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer launched in May 2002 on board the Aqua satellite. EWX aquires 0.05 x 0.05 degree spatial resolution MODIS LST

Daily: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Daily L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005 and

Monthly: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Monthly L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005

data using NASA's WIST server. The daily data is averaged into dekads, the monthly data is used to create the 2-monthly and 3-monthly data. Individual observations are subtracted from the time series mean to produce anomaly data. Zscores are determined by dividing the anomaly by the standard deviation over the available data.

All three products, data, anomaly and zscores are converted to GeoTiffs to be ingested into EWX.

folder.name: fewschirps:fewschirps_fewscasia_3-month-{{month}}-{{year}}_mm_anomaly
folder.title: 3-Monthly
folder.description:
Climate Hazard group InfraRed Precipitation with Stations (CHIRPS) is a global (50%B0 S-50%B0 N, 180%B0 E-180%B0 W), 0.05%B0 resolution, 1981 to near-present gridded precipitation time series. CHIRPS data are produced by scientists at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB) Climate Hazard Group (CHG) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center. Data are provided as pentadal (5-day) composites. See readme for CHIRPS data.

Using IDL these data are accumulated to create monthly, 2-monthly and 3-monthly rainfall data. Individual observations are subtracted from the time series mean (2000-present) to produce anomaly data. Standard Precipitation Index maps (zscores) are made by applying a gamma function routine developed by Greg Husak, precip_2_spi_gh.pro

All three products, data, anomaly and zscores are converted to GeoTiffs to be ingested into EWX.

Questions?

About the Data: email Pete Peterson
About EWX: email Michael Budde

folder.description: MODIS LST is the Land Surface Temperature measured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer launched in May 2002 on board the Aqua satellite. EWX aquires 0.05 x 0.05 degree spatial resolution MODIS LST

folder.name: fewslstc6:fewslstc6_fewscasia_1-dekad-{{period}}-{{year}}_mm_data
folder.title: Dekadal
folder.description:
MODIS LST is the Land Surface Temperature measured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer launched in May 2002 on board the Aqua satellite. EWX aquires 0.05 x 0.05 degree spatial resolution MODIS LST

Daily: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Daily L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005 and

Monthly: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Monthly L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005

data using NASA's WIST server. The daily data is averaged into dekads, the monthly data is used to create the 2-monthly and 3-monthly data. Individual observations are subtracted from the time series mean to produce anomaly data. Zscores are determined by dividing the anomaly by the standard deviation over the available data.

All three products, data, anomaly and zscores are converted to GeoTiffs to be ingested into EWX.

CHIRPS data are produced by scientists at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB) Climate Hazard Group (CHG) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center. Data are provided as pentadal (5-day) composites. See readme for CHIRPS data.

Using IDL these data are accumulated to create monthly, 2-monthly and 3-monthly rainfall data. Individual observations are subtracted from the time series mean (2000-present) to produce anomaly data. Standard Precipitation Index maps (zscores) are made by applying a gamma function routine developed by Greg Husak, precip_2_spi_gh.pro

All three products, data, anomaly and zscores are converted to GeoTiffs to be ingested into EWX.

Questions?

About the Data: email Pete Peterson
About EWX: email Michael Budde

folder.title: LST_C6
folder.description: MODIS LST is the Land Surface Temperature measured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer launched in May 2002 on board the Aqua satellite. EWX aquires 0.05 x 0.05 degree spatial resolution MODIS LST

folder.name: fewslstc6:fewslstc6_fewsafrica_1-dekad-{{period}}-{{year}}_mm_data
folder.title: Dekadal
folder.description:
MODIS LST is the Land Surface Temperature measured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer launched in May 2002 on board the Aqua satellite. EWX aquires 0.05 x 0.05 degree spatial resolution MODIS LST

Daily: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Daily L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005 and

Monthly: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Monthly L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005

data using NASA's WIST server. The daily data is averaged into dekads, the monthly data is used to create the 2-monthly and 3-monthly data. Individual observations are subtracted from the time series mean to produce anomaly data. Zscores are determined by dividing the anomaly by the standard deviation over the available data.

All three products, data, anomaly and zscores are converted to GeoTiffs to be ingested into EWX.

Questions?

About the Data: email Pete Peterson
About EWX: email Michael Budde

folder.name: fewslstc6:fewslstc6_fewsafrica_1-month-{{month}}-{{year}}_mm_anomaly
folder.title: Monthly
folder.description:
MODIS LST is the Land Surface Temperature measured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer launched in May 2002 on board the Aqua satellite. EWX aquires 0.05 x 0.05 degree spatial resolution MODIS LST

Daily: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Daily L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005 and

Monthly: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Monthly L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005

data using NASA's WIST server. The daily data is averaged into dekads, the monthly data is used to create the 2-monthly and 3-monthly data. Individual observations are subtracted from the time series mean to produce anomaly data. Zscores are determined by dividing the anomaly by the standard deviation over the available data.

All three products, data, anomaly and zscores are converted to GeoTiffs to be ingested into EWX.

Questions?

folder.title: NDVI_C6
folder.description: eMODIS Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) data is produced by the US Geological Survey Earth Resources Observation and Science Center (USGS EROS) using Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) surface reflectance inputs provided by NASA. Please see the USGS FEWS NET eMODIS readme for more details.

folder.name: fewsemodisc6:fewsemodisc6_fewscasia_1-dekad-{{period}}-{{year}}_mm_data
folder.title: Dekadal
folder.description: eMODIS Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) data is produced by the US Geological Survey Earth Resources Observation and Science Center (USGS EROS) using Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) surface reflectance inputs provided by NASA. Please see the USGS FEWS NET eMODIS readme for more details.</br></br>eMODIS NDVI data, at 250 meter spatial resolution, are composited on a 10-day interval and created every 5 days. Here, we provide both data and anomalies for each dekadal (10-day) period. Dekadal observations are subtracted from the time series mean (2001-2010) to produce the anomaly data.</br></br>Time series NDVI values are scaled from 0 to 200 and can be converted to NDVI units by applying the following formula: [NDVI = (DN-100)/100].</br></br>Questions?</br></br>About the Data: email Mike Budde</br>About EWX: email Michelle Anthony

folder.description: eMODIS Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) data is produced by the US Geological Survey Earth Resources Observation and Science Center (USGS EROS) using Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) surface reflectance inputs provided by NASA. Please see the USGS FEWS NET eMODIS readme for more details.</br></br>eMODIS NDVI data, at 250 meter spatial resolution, are composited on a 10-day interval and created every 5 days. Here, we provide both data and anomalies for each dekadal (10-day) period. Dekadal observations are subtracted from the time series mean (2001-2010) to produce the anomaly data.</br></br>Time series NDVI values are scaled from 0 to 200 and can be converted to NDVI units by applying the following formula: [NDVI = (DN-100)/100].</br></br>Questions?</br></br>About the Data: email Mike Budde</br>About EWX: email Michelle Anthony

folder.title: CHIRPS
folder.description: Climate Hazard group InfraRed Precipitation with Stations (CHIRPS) is a global (50%B0 S-50%B0 N, 180%B0 E-180%B0 W), 0.05%B0 resolution, 1981 to near-present gridded precipitation time series. CHIRPS data are produced by scientists at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB) Climate Hazard Group (CHG) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center. Data are provided as pentadal (5-day) composites. See readme for CHIRPS data.

folder.name: fewschirps:fewschirps_fewsmideast_1-pentad-{{period}}-{{year}}_mm_data
folder.title: Pentadal
folder.description:
Climate Hazard group InfraRed Precipitation with Stations (CHIRPS) is a global (50%B0 S-50%B0 N, 180%B0 E-180%B0 W), 0.05%B0 resolution, 1981 to near-present gridded precipitation time series. CHIRPS data are produced by scientists at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB) Climate Hazard Group (CHG) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center. Data are provided as pentadal (5-day) composites. See readme for CHIRPS data.

Using IDL these data are accumulated to create monthly, 2-monthly and 3-monthly rainfall data. Individual observations are subtracted from the time series mean (2000-present) to produce anomaly data. Standard Precipitation Index maps (zscores) are made by applying a gamma function routine developed by Greg Husak, precip_2_spi_gh.pro

All three products, data, anomaly and zscores are converted to GeoTiffs to be ingested into EWX.

Questions?

About the Data: email Pete Peterson
About EWX: email Michael Budde

folder.name: fewslstc6:fewslstc6_fewsmideast_1-dekad-{{period}}-{{year}}_mm_data
folder.title: Dekadal
folder.description:
MODIS LST is the Land Surface Temperature measured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer launched in May 2002 on board the Aqua satellite. EWX aquires 0.05 x 0.05 degree spatial resolution MODIS LST

Daily: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Daily L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005 and

Monthly: MODIS/Aqua Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Monthly L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V005

data using NASA's WIST server. The daily data is averaged into dekads, the monthly data is used to create the 2-monthly and 3-monthly data. Individual observations are subtracted from the time series mean to produce anomaly data. Zscores are determined by dividing the anomaly by the standard deviation over the available data.

All three products, data, anomaly and zscores are converted to GeoTiffs to be ingested into EWX.
